00020 #include <core1serialization_binary/binarywriter.h>
00021 
00024 using namespace RDK2;
00025 
00026 class B: public Serializable {
00027     char dieci[10];
00028     
00029     void write(Writer*) throw (WritingException);
00030     void read(Reader*)  throw (ReadingException);
00031 };
00032 
00033 class A: public Serializable {
00034     B becero;
00035     int cavallo;
00036 
00037     void write(Writer*) throw (WritingException);
00038     void read(Reader*r)  throw (ReadingException);
00039 };
00040 
00041     void B::write(Writer*) {
00042         r->startWriting("b");
00043             r->writeBuffer("dieci", 10, buffer);
00044         r->doneWriting();
00045     }
00046     
00047     void B::read(Reader*r)  throw (FormatE) {
00048         r->startReading("b");
00049             r->loadBuffer("dieci", 10, buffer);
00050         r->doneReading();
00051     }
00052     
00053     void A::write(Reader*r)  throw (FormatE) {
00054         r->startWriting("a");
00055             r->writeObject("becero", &becero);
00056             r->writeInt("cavallo");
00057         r->doneWriting();
00058     }
00059 
00060     void A::read(Reader*r)  throw (FormatE) {
00061         r->startReading("a");
00062             r->loadObject("becero", &becero);
00063             cavallo = r->loadInt("cavallo");
00064             if(cavallo<=0) throw FormatE("Dove vado senza un cavallo?");
00065         r->doneReading();
00066     }
00067 
00068     
00069 void main() {
00070     // I nostri dati
00071     A a; a.cavallo = 12;
00072     
00073     // Scrittura come xml
00074     XMLWriter xmlWriter; 
00075     string xml = xmlWriter.serialize(&a);
00076     
00077     // Scrittura come stringa binaria
00078     BinaryWriter binaryWriter;
00079     string binary = binaryWriter.serialize(&a);
00080     
00081     // Lettura da xml
00082     XMLReader xmlReader;
00083     A a2;
00084     xmlReader.deserialize(xml, &a2);    
00085     // Lettura (anonima) da xml
00086     Readable * readable = xmlReader.deserialize(xml);
00087     
00088     // Lettura binaria
00089     BinaryReader binaryReader;
00090     A a3;
00091     binaryReader.deserialize(binary, &a3);
00092     // Lettura (anonima) binaria: ovviamente non possibile 
00093 }
